name: Abbey Griffin
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance
flavor_text:
"The darkness crawls with vampires and ghouls, but we are not without allies."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Altar's Reap
oracle_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
flavor_text:
"The demons don't care if we mutter niceties and act out ceremonies. Just kill him."
—Bishop Volpaig, servant of Griselbrand

name: Ambush Viper
oracle_text:
Flash
Deathtouch
flavor_text:
"Living creatures seldom impress me. But I like this one."
—Uta Falkenrath

name: Ancient Grudge
oracle_text:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar—especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.

name: Armored Skaab
oracle_text: When Armored Skaab enters the battlefield, mill four cards.
flavor_text: Literally made for battle.

name: Ashmouth Hound
oracle_text: Whenever Ashmouth Hound blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Ashmouth Hound deals 1 damage to that creature.
flavor_text: Its fiery paws make it easy to track, which is very useful when you want to go in exactly the opposite direction.

name: Avacynian Priest
oracle_text: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.
flavor_text: Moorlanders speak in awe of the priests' talent for arriving just in time to drive off the wicked things that prowl the ravished parish.

name: Avacyn's Pilgrim
oracle_text: {T}: Add {W}.
flavor_text: "Avacyn's protection is everywhere. From the holy church to the sacred glade, all that we see is under her blessed watch."

name: Blazing Torch
oracle_text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked by Vampires or Zombies.
Equipped creature has "{T}, Sacrifice Blazing Torch: Blazing Torch deals 2 damage to any target."
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Bloodcrazed Neonate
oracle_text:
Bloodcrazed Neonate attacks each combat if able.
Whenever Bloodcrazed Neonate deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor_text: While elder vampires select their meals with care, the newly sired frenzy at the first whiff.

name: Bonds of Faith
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.
flavor_text:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound."
—Oath of Avacyn

name: Brain Weevil
oracle_text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Sacrifice Brain Weevil: Target player discards two cards. Activate only as a sorcery.

name: Brimstone Volley
oracle_text:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to any target.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage instead if a creature died this turn.

name: Bump in the Night
oracle_text:
Target opponent loses 3 life.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: It's not just the wind. It's not all in your head. And it's *definitely* something to worry about.

name: Caravan Vigil
oracle_text:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Morbid — You may put that card onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your hand if a creature died this turn.

name: Chapel Geist
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: Death has bound it with chains of past regrets. Forever it searches for atonement, each kindness removing a single link.

name: Claustrophobia
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
When Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
flavor_text: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.

name: Cobbled Wings
oracle_text:
Equipped creature has flying.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
flavor_text: For the necro-alchemist, any puzzle can be solved with intelligence and harvested body parts.

name: Corpse Lunge
oracle_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Corpse Lunge deals damage equal to the exiled card's power to target creature.

name: Crossway Vampire
oracle_text: When Crossway Vampire enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
flavor_text: "Do not flatter Fate. It did not guide you into my clutches tonight. That was all my doing."

name: Curse of Oblivion
oracle_text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player exiles two cards from their graveyard.
flavor_text: The first step to peace is to learn how to forget.

name: Curse of the Bloody Tome
oracle_text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, that player mills two cards.
flavor_text: After seeing his life's work drip away, the mage decided it was a good time to go crazy.

name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
oracle_text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player or a planeswalker that player controls.
flavor_text:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse

name: Darkthicket Wolf
oracle_text: {2}{G}: Darkthicket Wolf gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate only once each turn.
flavor_text: Werewolf slayers don't know for certain how werewolves are created. So they kill all the wolves, just to be safe.

name: Dead Weight
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
flavor_text: The crueler vampires' idea of free-range farming.

name: Delver of Secrets // Insectile Aberration
type_line: Creature — Human Wizard // Creature — Human Insect

card_faces.name: Delver of Secrets
card_faces.oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may reveal that card. If an instant or sorcery card is revealed this way, transform Delver of Secrets.

card_faces.name: Insectile Aberration
card_faces.flavor_text:
"Unfortunately, all my test animals have died or escaped, so I shall be the final subject. I feel no fear. This is a momentous night."
—Laboratory notes, final entry

all_parts.name: Delver of Secrets // Insectile Aberration
all_parts.type_line: Creature — Human Wizard // Creature — Human Insect

name: Deranged Assistant
oracle_text: {T}, Mill a card: Add {C}. (To mill a card, put the top card of your library into your graveyard.)
flavor_text: "Garl, adjust the slurry dispensers. Garl, fetch more corpses. Garl, quit crying and give me your brain tissue. If he doesn't stop being so rude, I'm quitting."

name: Doomed Traveler
oracle_text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
flavor_text: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.

name: Dream Twist
oracle_text:
Target player mills three cards.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Elder Cathar
oracle_text: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.
flavor_text: "My greatest hope is that you will surpass me in every way, consigning my name to some forgotten corner of history."

name: Feeling of Dread
oracle_text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: People only say "I'm sure it was nothing" when they're sure it was something.

name: Feral Ridgewolf
oracle_text:
Trample
{1}{R}: Feral Ridgewolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The wolves no longer hunt just to feed. They kill for sport, or for some madness behind their eyes."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

name: Festerhide Boar
oracle_text:
Trample
Morbid — Festerhide Boar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
flavor_text:
"Bury your dead deep. The boars are hungriest while the corpse is still warm."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

name: Forbidden Alchemy
oracle_text:
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Fortress Crab
flavor_text: Unbreakable and unappetizing, the crab grows uninterrupted, sometimes to the size of a cottage and beyond.

name: Frightful Delusion
oracle_text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}. That player discards a card.
flavor_text: Whether he actually exists is in question, but the terror she feels is excruciatingly real.

name: Furor of the Bitten
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each combat if able.
flavor_text: Those who only believe themselves infected with lycanthropy can be as dangerous as those who really are.

name: Geistflame
oracle_text:
Geistflame deals 1 damage to any target.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: Innistrad pyromancers find their best raw materials in the fury of the dead.

name: Ghostly Possession
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

name: Ghoulcaller's Bell
oracle_text: {T}: Each player mills a card.
flavor_text: The bell's chime heralds the rise of the unhallowed from the grave and the fall of their victims into the earth.

name: Ghoulcaller's Chant
oracle_text:
Choose one —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return two target Zombie cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"The living are born small and weak. The dead rise ready to serve. The choice is obvious."
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony

name: Ghoulraiser
oracle_text: When Ghoulraiser enters the battlefield, return a Zombie card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"Come. Bring your brothers. Tonight, you feast on living flesh."
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Gnaw to the Bone
oracle_text:
You gain 2 life for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {2}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Grave Bramble
oracle_text: Defender, protection from Zombies
flavor_text: Nature abhors a zombie.

card_faces.name: Grizzled Outcasts
card_faces.oracle_text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Grizzled Outcasts.
card_faces.flavor_text: Seen as unsavory, the hunters were never allowed in town—until one night they vanished.

card_faces.name: Krallenhorde Wantons
card_faces.oracle_text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Krallenhorde Wantons.
card_faces.flavor_text: The boot prints became paw prints, and they led right back into town.

name: Gruesome Deformity
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has intimidate. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
flavor_text: She wanted to inspire terror wherever she went. The demons happily granted her wish.

name: Harvest Pyre
oracle_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile X cards from your graveyard.
Harvest Pyre deals X damage to target creature.
flavor_text: Corpses destroyed by fire form the most destructive geists.

name: Hysterical Blindness
oracle_text: Creatures your opponents control get -4/-0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The panic is amusing, but the real fun comes when the spell passes and the villagers start looking for a scapegoat."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Infernal Plunge
oracle_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add {R}{R}{R}.
flavor_text: "Oh mighty Griselbrand, Scourge of the Heedless World, gladly I consume myself for thee!"

name: Kessig Wolf
oracle_text: {1}{R}: Kessig Wolf gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Don't be afraid when you hear the wolves howl. Be afraid when you don't hear them at all."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

name: Kindercatch
flavor_text: In the forest villages of Kessig, parents feed their children wormwood and other bitter herbs, hoping to make them less palatable to things that roam the night.

name: Lost in the Mist
oracle_text: Counter target spell. Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: The secrets she carried could have saved many lives, but they quietly drowned with her.

name: Makeshift Mauler
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
flavor_text:
"It always amazes me what perfectly good things people throw away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Manor Skeleton
oracle_text:
Haste
{1}{B}: Regenerate Manor Skeleton.
flavor_text: Lungs dried to parchment wheeze blasphemies within a cage of bleached bone.

name: Markov Patrician
oracle_text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
flavor_text: Vampires of the Markov bloodline pride themselves on their exquisite taste in fashion, art, and "wine of the vein."

name: Maw of the Mire
oracle_text: Destroy target land. You gain 4 life.
flavor_text: As the chapel was dragged under, the bell in the tower rang until the murky depths forever silenced its toll.

name: Moment of Heroism
oracle_text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
flavor_text: "My faith is stronger than fang, claw, or mindless hunger."

name: Moon Heron
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: The heron is the symbol of the archangel Avacyn. The fact that such spirits still fly gives the church hope that its founder may one day return.

name: Moonmist
oracle_text: Transform all Humans. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures other than Werewolves and Wolves. (Only double-faced cards can be transformed.)

name: Mulch
oracle_text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor_text: The land knows no difference between the graves of commoners and nobles.

name: Naturalize
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor_text:
"Stone and thought fade into ruin. Only the wind in the leaves will endure."
—Tomb inscription

name: Nightbird's Clutches
oracle_text:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: Shiny polished silver can ward off many creatures, but it attracts others.

name: Night Revelers
oracle_text: Night Revelers has haste as long as an opponent controls a Human.
flavor_text: Vampires think of themselves as the indisputable nobility of Innistrad, able to do as they please. There are few who can prove them wrong.

name: Night Terrors
oracle_text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
flavor_text: Innistrad is a place where dreams invade the mind and mere shadows exact a terrible toll.

name: One-Eyed Scarecrow
oracle_text:
Defender
Creatures with flying your opponents control get -1/-0.
flavor_text: Farmhands and priests mutter curses at the ragged thing; it unnerves more than just the crows.

name: Orchard Spirit
oracle_text: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
flavor_text:
"Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

name: Pitchburn Devils
oracle_text: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to any target.
flavor_text: The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep.

name: Prey Upon
oracle_text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor_text:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

name: Ranger's Guile
oracle_text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
flavor_text: In the remote corners of Kessig, protection is found in secret powers unknown to the Church of Avacyn.

name: Rebuke
oracle_text: Destroy target attacking creature.
flavor_text:
"No one chooses to be stitched together into a skaab. If it could speak, it would beg for its own destruction."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Riot Devils
flavor_text: Devils are demons' unearthly desires made flesh. Let loose on the world, they satisfy their mad craving for destruction in a whirlwind of chaos.

name: Rotting Fensnake
flavor_text: Its venom sacs are long gone, but its crushing strength is somehow greater than ever.

name: Selfless Cathar
oracle_text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Selfless Cathar: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: "If I fail to offer myself, we will surely be overrun. My fate would be the same."

name: Selhoff Occultist
oracle_text: Whenever Selhoff Occultist or another creature dies, target player mills a card.
flavor_text: "The mist whispers to those who know it to be more than a mundane fog."

name: Sensory Deprivation
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
flavor_text: They call it "stitcher's anesthesia," a spell to deaden the senses while the mad doctors begin their grisly work.

name: Shimmering Grotto
oracle_text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
flavor_text:
"This is the price of being last in the food chain. We must keep our places of beauty hidden away instead of displayed for all to see."
—Hildin, priest of Avacyn

name: Silent Departure
oracle_text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: The same magic that lets geists pass through our realm can force them out of it.

name: Silverchase Fox
oracle_text: {1}{W}, Sacrifice Silverchase Fox: Exile target enchantment.
flavor_text:
"Be careful in your hunt. The clever little creature can steal your wards and lead you right into the werewolf's den."
—Britta, midwife of Gatstaf

name: Skeletal Grimace
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
flavor_text:
"And then I realized we all have skeletons on the inside. Why wait until the bodies are dead to control them?"
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia

name: Smite the Monstrous
oracle_text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
flavor_text: Though the old holy wards and roadside shrines have begun to fail, faith in Avacyn still holds true power.

name: Somberwald Spider
oracle_text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morbid — Somberwald Spider enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
flavor_text: Stensian vampires encourage spiders near their manors so they can rob the webs.

name: Spare from Evil
oracle_text: Creatures you control gain protection from non-Human creatures until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"As long as we can utter a prayer or lift a weapon, we have the power to fight back."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

name: Spectral Flight
oracle_text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying.
flavor_text:
"The church looks down on binding spirits into armor, but now I can look down on them."
—Dierk, geistmage

name: Spidery Grasp
oracle_text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
flavor_text:
"Nobody's seen the Lady of Videns for years. Poor dear, no companions at all in that old castle."
—Yonda of Gavony

name: Stitched Drake
oracle_text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Flying
flavor_text:
"The best skaab are more powerful and more beautiful than the sum of their parts."
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Stitcher's Apprentice
oracle_text: {1}{U}, {T}: Create a 2/2 blue Homunculus creature token, then sacrifice a creature.
flavor_text: "Oglor create life, Oglor take it away. Oglor god! . . . until Master return."

name: Stromkirk Patrol
oracle_text: Whenever Stromkirk Patrol deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor_text: "You'd best move along, human. Our palates are far less discerning than our master's."

name: Think Twice
oracle_text:
Draw a card.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: "Either I know just the spell I need, or I'm about to."

name: Thraben Purebloods
flavor_text:
"I've learned to trust my dogs' instincts. When they're calm, I'm calm. And when they get nervous, I get my crossbow."
—Hinrik of House Cecani

name: Thraben Sentry // Thraben Militia
type_line: Creature — Human Soldier // Creature — Human Soldier

card_faces.name: Thraben Sentry
card_faces.oracle_text:
Vigilance
Whenever another creature you control dies, you may transform Thraben Sentry.
card_faces.flavor_text: "Looks like it's going to be a quiet night."

card_faces.name: Thraben Militia
card_faces.flavor_text: "The time for grief is over. The time for retribution has begun."

all_parts.name: Thraben Sentry // Thraben Militia
all_parts.type_line: Creature — Human Soldier // Creature — Human Soldier

name: Tormented Pariah // Rampaging Werewolf
type_line: Creature — Human Warrior Werewolf // Creature — Werewolf

card_faces.name: Tormented Pariah
card_faces.oracle_text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Tormented Pariah.
card_faces.flavor_text: "Hey lads, the moon's rising. All the better to watch him beg for mercy."

card_faces.name: Rampaging Werewolf
card_faces.oracle_text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Rampaging Werewolf.
card_faces.flavor_text: "Just look at him, groveling on all fours! What a pathetic—uh-oh."

all_parts.name: Tormented Pariah // Rampaging Werewolf
all_parts.type_line: Creature — Human Warrior Werewolf // Creature — Werewolf

name: Traitorous Blood
oracle_text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains trample and haste until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"I can make you dance to my tune like a puppet, your very blood eager to obey."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Traveler's Amulet
oracle_text: {1}, Sacrifice Traveler's Amulet: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
flavor_text: The rider set off into the eerie mist, swaddled in armor and laden with amulets.

name: Travel Preparations
oracle_text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on each of up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
flavor_text: Visiting a shrine at the start of a journey makes the traveler more likely to finish it.

name: Typhoid Rats
oracle_text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
flavor_text: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.

name: Unruly Mob
oracle_text: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Unruly Mob.
flavor_text:
"Who says werewolves are the only ones who can hunt as a pack?"
—Kolman, elder of Gatstaf

name: Urgent Exorcism
oracle_text: Destroy target Spirit or enchantment.
flavor_text:
"To show geists pity is to prolong their agonies. Whether they know it or not, they seek the Blessed Sleep, and we are to give it to them."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Vampire Interloper
oracle_text:
Flying
Vampire Interloper can't block.
flavor_text: He listens to every heartbeat, deciding which one of hundreds he will stop.

name: Vampiric Fury
oracle_text: Vampire creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.

name: Victim of Night
oracle_text: Destroy target non-Vampire, non-Werewolf, non-Zombie creature.
flavor_text:
"Do not touch a drop. Not yet. I want to watch this so-called slayer's last crisis of faith."
—Olivia Voldaren

name: Village Bell-Ringer
oracle_text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Village Bell-Ringer enters the battlefield, untap all creatures you control.
flavor_text: "Priests, hunters, slayers—to arms! The enemy approaches!"

card_faces.name: Village Ironsmith
card_faces.oracle_text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Ironsmith.
card_faces.flavor_text: Each night, he abandons the trappings of civilization.

card_faces.name: Ironfang
card_faces.oracle_text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ironfang.
card_faces.flavor_text: Each morning, he repairs the front door.

name: Villagers of Estwald // Howlpack of Estwald

card_faces.name: Villagers of Estwald
card_faces.oracle_text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Villagers of Estwald.
card_faces.flavor_text: You can spot a werewolf-infested town by its lack of butcher shops.

card_faces.name: Howlpack of Estwald
card_faces.oracle_text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack of Estwald.
card_faces.flavor_text: Estwald's citizens don't dislike outsiders—they taste just fine.

all_parts.name: Villagers of Estwald // Howlpack of Estwald

name: Voiceless Spirit
oracle_text: Flying, first strike
flavor_text:
"I'd rather take on a neckbiter or moonhowler any day. Oh well, looks like I'm going to end up parrying with empty air half the night."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer

name: Walking Corpse
flavor_text:
"Is it hopeless? When wave upon wave of our dead return as mindless flesh-eaters to claw upon Thraben's walls? We're too busy cutting them down to indulge ourselves in such philosophical foppery."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Wooden Stake
oracle_text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0.
Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by a Vampire, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

name: Woodland Sleuth
oracle_text: Morbid — When Woodland Sleuth enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text: "Whatever did this is near. Death reversion has not yet occurred. Be alert!"
